{"blocks":[{"key":"1b3tl","text":"Important note: DIMPLE breaks a gene up into sub-library fragments and generates mutagenic insert oligo pools, where each oligo contains barcodes, Type IIS restriction cutsites, and a sub-region of the gene. Be sure to review your library generation vector and gene sequences and look for pre-existing Type IIS restriction sites. Use site-directed mutagenesis to remove unwanted off-target sites.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5lpau","text":"Oligo length: Designate the length of your oligo. {"blocks":[{"key":"3h9pt","text":"Fragment length: You can adjust the length of your fragments, we recommend leaving the fragment length set to auto.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"245dp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vin9","text":"DIMPLE will automatically break up your gene into roughly the same fragment sizes, and will determine which lengths work best to avoid matching overhangs.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"am1n1","text":"Barcode start position: The software selects from a set pool of barcodes when designing oligos. {"blocks":[{"key":"9gg8f","text":"Type IIS restriction sequence: You can select which Type IIS restriction cutsite you'd like to append to your inserts and backbone.
